snippet: The state attorney general and his Republican opponent said donations should not be accepted from companies under investigation.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric Schneiderman and challenger John Cahill both say that political associations run by Democratic and Republican attorneys general must discontinue taking money from corporations that are targets of investigations; Schneiderman says he may step down from his party’s group if it did not curtail practice.

byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The state attorney general and his Republican opponent said donations should not be accepted from companies under investigation.

headline.main: Donations Are Assailed by Hopefuls in New York
headline.print_headline: Donations Are Assailed by Hopefuls in New York
